job_title: Microsoft Foundry - Student Developers and Designers
job_description: Microsoft Foundry InternshipAt the Foundry, student developers and designers spend twelve weeks building apps for Microsoft’s newest platforms, from inception to the marketplace, success depends on you.Foundry students work together on small teams to Learn, Collaborate, Build, & Launch Windows and Windows Phone apps.  Student teams work closely with coaches and technical leaders from across Microsoft, and have access to some of the coolest hardware and technology around.Internship Overview• 12-16 week paid internship• Open to developers and designers• Offers 2 internship time frames; January to March and June to August• Open to Co-Op internshipsProgram PrinciplesLearn – Foundry students learn design and development skills for touch-enabled platforms through structured training programs, impromptu tech talks and individual support from coaches and tech advisors.Collaborate – Foundry students work on small teams with other students, with guidance and coaching from experienced technical leaders from across Microsoft.Build – Foundry students build apps on our latest platforms, learning the latest development techniques and getting a first look at future technologies.Launch – The Foundry provides a start-up atmosphere where the teams use agile development to iterate and launch quickly, with the resources of a big company to release apps into the Windows and Windows Phone Marketplaces.What do you get out of it?• Unique development and design experience, including building for touch technology and leveraging cloud computing• Opportunity to build and launch an app, end-to-end• Strengthen development and design skills while building first-hand experience shipping apps for Windows and Windows Phone
